# ObjectStack Development Prompts

This directory contains AI prompt files that guide development of ObjectStack applications like HotCRM.

## Quick Start

**New to ObjectStack?** Start with the [AI Quick Reference](./ai-quick-reference.prompt.md) for templates and patterns.

## Prompt Files

| File | Purpose | Use When |
|------|---------|----------|
| [ai-quick-reference.prompt.md](./ai-quick-reference.prompt.md) | **Quick lookup guide** with templates, patterns, and examples | You need quick reference for common tasks |
| [metadata.prompt.md](./metadata.prompt.md) | File suffix protocol and coding standards | Creating any metadata files |
| [capabilities.prompt.md](./capabilities.prompt.md) | Platform capabilities and design patterns | Planning features or architecture |
| [app.prompt.md](./app.prompt.md) | Enterprise application architecture | Building complex multi-domain apps |
| [project-structure.prompt.md](./project-structure.prompt.md) | Project organization and structure | Setting up or organizing projects |
| [logic.prompt.md](./logic.prompt.md) | Business logic and hooks | Adding automation and triggers |
| [formulas.prompt.md](./formulas.prompt.md) | Formula fields and expressions | Creating calculated fields |
| [lifecycle.prompt.md](./lifecycle.prompt.md) | Record lifecycle and workflows | Managing record states |
| [testing.prompt.md](./testing.prompt.md) | Testing strategies and patterns | Writing tests |
| [data-seed.prompt.md](./data-seed.prompt.md) | Sample data generation | Creating test data |
| [deployment.prompt.md](./deployment.prompt.md) | Deployment and operations | Deploying applications |

## Usage

These prompts are designed to be read by AI agents to understand ObjectStack conventions and best practices. They provide:

- **Protocol specifications**: File naming, type definitions, schemas
- **Templates**: Copy-paste examples for common scenarios
- **Best practices**: Proven patterns for enterprise development
- **Decision trees**: When to use which capability

## Contributing

When adding new prompts:

1. Use English only (per project documentation standards)
2. Follow the existing format and structure
3. Include practical examples and code snippets
4. Keep it concise and actionable
5. Update this README with new entries
